Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a habitat scene, choosing either a land habitat (like a forest or park) or a water habitat (like a pond or stream).
The student can include various living things in their drawing, such as trees, bushes, flowering plants, animals like lizards and squirrels, or water creatures like fish and clams.
The student can show how different types of living things exist in the chosen habitat.
The student can illustrate patterns, such as how similar types of plants or animals are grouped together.
The student can label their drawing to help identify the different plants and animals shown.
